question: Which Indian journalist has been selected as a recipient of the Freedom of Speech Award presented by Deutsche Welle?
explanation:
Indian journalist and the founding editor of ‘The Wire’, Siddharth Varadarajan has been named one of the 17 recipients of the Freedom of Speech Award presented by German public international broadcaster, Deutsche Welle also called as DW.
The award is conferred on journalists who show outstanding commitment to human rights and freedom of expression in the media. Amid the Covid-19 pandemic, the winners represent the journalists who have disappeared or been arrested or threatened because of their reporting on the COVID-19 pandemic.
